nodes.body:
Hmm we need the string it was parsing here (one line in the output of the tool). Are you able to run the build under a debugger to get it? You will want to set /m:1 so there's only one process.

Setting environment variable MSBUILDDEBUGONSTART=1 may be helpful as it pauses to allow you to attach.

Hello, and thank you for your response.  I have been unsuccessfully trying to reproduce.  The only difference is that I left a clean build going overnight, and now those exceptions don't happen anymore:

Build succeeded.
    0 Warning(s)
    0 Error(s)

Time Elapsed 00:02:13.05
Cleaning build logs
Found 0 byte file "D:\sechs\Compute-Fabric-HostAgent\src\runtime\test\logeventhandling\msbuild.err"
Found 0 byte file "D:\sechs\Compute-Fabric-HostAgent\src\runtime\test\logeventhandling\msbuild.wrn"
D:\sechs\Compute-Fabric-HostAgent\src\runtime\test\logeventhandling»

Maybe some object or symbol files were messed up after many partial builds?
Could be, but that wouldn't explain the callstack. Hmm.
